page.title: 17Wildlife in Screel Area 1
page.content: On Monday the 27th of May 1985, our Domesday group went exploring our area. The area, being very rural, has lots of wildlife. When we walked along one particular road we saw an adder. Adders have black zig-zag markings on their backs and the ones we saw looked exactly like what I've described them like. An adder is dangerous because of its poisonous bite. If when you are bitten you rush around screaming, then the poison gets through your body quicker, so you will most probably die but if you keep still and stay calm for about half an hour then your blood would clean away the poison and you would be fine. We also noticed some deer when we were walking and we've learnt that they are red deer. In Scotland as forests disappear it is becoming a moorland
